response: "I can't handle this pressure anymore, it's suffocating me. Why do I have to be perfect for everyone else?"
"I feel like I'm losing touch with reality. The constant expectations and judgments are driving me crazy."
"What is even real anymore? I can't distinguish between my own desires and society's expectations."
"Am I the only one feeling this way? It seems like everyone else has it all figured out."
"I'm exhausted from trying to meet these impossible standards. Will I ever be good enough?"
"I can't keep up with all the trends and ideals. It's like chasing a mirage that keeps moving further away."
"I'm starting to question my own identity. Who am I really, beneath all these layers of societal expectations?"
"It feels like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of perfectionism. When will I be allowed to just be myself?"
"Every time I think I've achieved something, there's always a new benchmark to reach. It's driving me insane."
"I just want to break free from this pressure and find my own definition of happiness. But it feels impossible."
